full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 226 of 228 902 LC2Qmax7 - corrected Alessi - Direct 1 Q. Were you arrested or charged with a crime? 2 A. No. 3 Q. After that incident, did you ever see Mr. Epstein in person again? 4 5 A. Never. 6 MS. COMEY: May I have a moment, your Honor? 7 THE COURT: You may. 8 (Pause) 9 MS. COMEY: Nothing further, your Honor. 10 THE COURT: I'll leave it to you, Mr. Pagliuca. Do 11 you want to start or do you want -- 12 MR. PAGLIUCA: I think it would be better if we start 13 tomorrow. 14 THE COURT: That's fine. We only have ten minutes. 15 Members of the jury, we'll send you home for the 16 evening. Same schedule tomorrow. We'll start promptly at 17 9:30. Thank you for your diligence. We'll see you in the 18 morning. 19 (Jury not present) 20 THE COURT: Mr. Alessi, you may step down. 21 MR. PAGLIUCA: Your Honor, I don't recall whether the 22 Court's practice is to admonish the witness when he's on 23 cross-examination or not. 24 MS. COMEY: We have no intention of having any 25 substantive communications with the witness other than SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018099
